snippet: Two advocacy groups in Chicago are running dueling ads over the meaning of jihad: one campaign is focused on a nonviolent interpretation of the word, the other on its association with terrorism.
abstract: Two advocacy groups in Chicago are running dueling ads over the meaning of jihad; campaign by Muslim group Council on American-Islmac Relations is focused on a nonviolent interpretation of the word; pro-Israel group American Freedom Defense Initiative focuses on its association with terrorism.

byline.original: By STEVEN YACCINO and POH SI TENG

lead_paragraph: Two advocacy groups in Chicago are running dueling ads over the meaning of jihad: one campaign is focused on a nonviolent interpretation of the word, the other on its association with terrorism.

headline.seo: Ad Campaigns Fight It Out Over Meaning of ‘Jihad’
headline.main: Using Billboards to Stake Claim Over ‘Jihad’
headline.print_headline: Using Billboards To Stake Claim Over ‘Jihad’
